FYI: the searchtools guys are up for us using anything we like, as long as 
credit is given and we say hey to Brewster on behalf of Avi ;).

pt.

---------- Forwarded message ----------
Date: Wed, 18 Jun 2003 17:34:24 -0700
From: Avi Rappoport <avirr@...>

Hi Parker,

Sure, I'm pleased to share my work with you.  Free and 
openly-distributable, as long as you give me a little public credit. 
When you're done, I'll link back to you.  You're also welcome to use 
any of my robots pages <http://www.searchtools.com/robots/> if you 
think they'll be helpful.

And say hi to Brewster for me.

Avi Rappoport
SearchTools.com

At 2:13 PM -0700 6/18/03, Parker Thompson wrote:
>Hello,
>
>I work for the Internet Archive and we are currently developing a web
>crawler.  As part of this process we are planning on developing a standard
>test squite, including a collection of pages that represent the types of
>material the crawler might encounter in the real-world.
>
>I see that this page:
>
>   http://www.searchtools.com/test/
>
>is a good start at what we're shooting for.  Would it be possible for us
>to use these pages?  Our requirements are that it must be free to us and
>freely distributable as part of our open source project:
>
>   http://sourceforge.net/projects/archive-crawler
>
>Please let me know if you have any questions.
>
>Thanks,
>
>pt.
>--
>Parker Thompson
>The Internet Archive
>510.541.0125
